Author: dejb
Content: To be perfectly frank I think he has a point. Paul Graham has some great things to say and he is certainly not braindead. But on this one I think he is dead wrong.

Author: pg
Content: But this one is disagreeing with something else.  Is this the Microsoft-isn't-dead thread, or the general pg-sucks thread?

Author: pg
Content: A taximeter is an example of a UI where small charges accumulate, and you don't have to think about them individually.

Content: Could you unpack that?  I'm not sure how taxicabs relate.
